title: It's impossible to climb silver as a support main
body: No matter how much I try to help my team, they throw, they dive, they get caught, I ward the crap out of the river and our jungle but somehow when it all seems to go so well, we lose. Yeah I know whatever 'if you're in silver that's probably where you're supposed to be', I know I'm not the best support anyone's ever seen but I can't help but get mad whenever we're winning and my team just stops thinking and goes kill hungry which almost always means an ace and game over. It pisses me off so much.

replies.body:
If you think that's bad, try being a jungle main when you have three feeding lanes all pinging constantly and asking for ganks, serving themselves up on a silver platter for the enemy jungler to gank as much as they want instead of playing it safe once they're already hemorrhaging kills, gold, and xp, and then them blaming you for it because you weren't able to gank three lanes and turn the tides in a 4v2 that they walked into inside of a bush that you were pinging them to stay away from.

I'm not saying supports don't have it bad. But for the first fifteen minutes of a map they only really have to watch out for one person. Junglers take hell the moment their Ezreal coughs up first blood to the enemy Vayne at minute 3.

As a SUPPORT main I can approve of this message.

Yeah we supports have it rough; it's hard having to protect someone from both the enemy AND from themselves, assisting the whole team by going into dangerous territory for the sake of vision, and once the laning phase ends it's our job to act as a support to 4 players instead of 1, but Junglers basically have it reversed, having to be a "support" for 3 lanes/4 players from the get go and then expected to be everywhere at once, it's pretty terrible. 

It's also why I don't jungle, as I'm terrible at keeping myself fully aware of everything going on on the map, and im terrible at predicting what the enemy jungler is going to do and where they're going to be, etc etc. You guys have to play chess while all we supports have to do in comparison is babysit and play lookout more or less.

You have my respect and my sympathies.

Hi, my name is Venaven and I started from Silver two seasons in a row and worked my way up to diamond by playing support almost exclusively. You being stuck in silver isn't due to the league you're in, it's your inability to understand how to properly climb with your role. Silver is incredibly easy regardless of the role you're playing provided you actually are of a higher skill level than the bracket, which you're clearly, evidently not. 
Sorry that this sounds rude, but the reality is simply that you're not as good as you think you are and if you're stuck in silver, then you do in fact belong in silver. Of course you've picked a role that you believe to be low impact if those around you are less skillful, because that way it's easier for you to believe that you're just "trapped in elo hell", but the reality is that supports carry harder than ADCs ESPECIALLY in lower elo during the laning phase. You don't actually know what you're doing, and you are in fact a silver skill level, sorry.
I know I'll probably be downvoted to oblivion by players who are also trapped in silver and bronze and believe that it's due to their teammates, while they fail to understand that you need to carry in order to climb, and that, regardless of surrounding ineptitude, carrying at lower elos is incredibly easy if you're actually a high skill level (ie not silver or bronze), but oh well, it's to be expected. If you actually want to climb, you need to be willing first and foremost to accept that it's your fault and you need to improve, even if everyone around you is bad, you need to get better in order to carry them, and if you can't do that, then you're bad too, and you probably are a lot worse than you think you are and don't fully realize your own mistakes, of which there are an innumerable amount at lower elos, because even in platinum or diamond or beyond players still make tons of mistakes. Having to carry your team, a team which appears "inferior" in relation to the enemy's team (due to bias and an inability to swing the momentum of the game properly) is something that never goes away, and in fact only gets HARDER as your elo rises. If you think that you're "stuck in elo hell" because of your team and carrying against the enemy team is too hard, then in what universe does this become easier at higher elos? It doesn't, it only gets worse and gets harder to carry because everyone involved is more skillful, yes your team will be better, but so will the enemy team, and your team is only "better" when compared to lower elos, but in the context of its own elo area it's on equal or slightly worse footing than the opposition usually, and with a larger skill pool to work with all around, all plays have more impact and more consequence, thus there is far more weight placed on the player wishing to carry, as there is less room for error and more effort required to overcome the skill level they're up against overall.

I was in a tournament at my college recently where the teams were mostly 1 plat and 4 silvers. I saw that the plat on the enemy team was an adc main, so I went support and effectively took him straight out of the game for an easy victory. you don't really see this is silver soloq, but once the adcs are competent its the supports skill that matters.

The skill difference between Silver n' Plat isin't that high. The mechanics of the ADC remain EXACTlY the same all the way up to the higher Plats. The two main variables are Decision making and the two lesser roles (Jungler and Support). If both the Support and Jungler play at a competent level you can easily carry.

Errr there isn't a big difference in mechanics from bronze-gold. Plat is when mechanics making really get refined. An exception to this is Plat 5 where the mechanics/decision making are completely variable. The development of decision making is fairly consistent through all leagues. Also, ADC has a very high skill cap. The issue with ADC is that they are stuck in a duo lane. To show how this is a factor there will be a bit of math (For this scenario we will say it is 50% whether you are better than them or not) . So 50% that you are a better adc, for you to win lane we will say that both you and your support must be better than the opponents. If one of you is better than your opponents but not the other the lane is canceled out. Using this method, you get a 25% chance of winning lane, a 25% chance of losing lane, and a 50% chance of the lane going even. This is why adc skill could possibly be considered less important than support or other lanes. The laners have a 50% chance of winning(on a side note i realized i didn't take consideration other lanes going even, however I feel that solo lanes usually do have a person that comes out substantially stronger even if the lane isnt 10/0) while adcs usually go even or don't have a substantial lead on the other team and can have less impact on the game than any laner until late game. One final point. If you look at Chinese adcs in a professional game or even Rekkles, you will see that adcs have a skill cap that is as high or higher than other laners.

Not to be a douche here, but Mid Silver has no mechanics. Low gold is like low silver. It is basically the same as the league under it and unless you can compare a ranked game between high gold to high silver then I don't think you can make the claim that their is no mechanical improvement. CSing is the most basic mechanic and is developed the earliest but gold-plat more mechanics are developed, such as when to shove lane, orb-walking and dealing with split pushing. Jungling development is primarily mechanical between silver and gold.Drag pressure gets really emphasized in mid to high gold which is where you see a lot of jungler decision making. To be brutally honest, statistically what your saying cannot be true because the ranking system is so steep. Since silver is in the middle of the curve the difference between gold and silver would be minimal (which it basically is). The difference between silver and plat has a much more severe slope than the silver to gold slope.The difference in mechanical skill would have to also increase dramatically.

Support role actually more complicated than solo lanes . People don't realize how much of a skill gap this role can have and often don't appreciate what supports do .

You can carry games as ap support in solo q. 

Good support can shut down both AD and other support which often will secure victory .

Some of the potential game support carries:

Annie - Build her as if you build ap carry . Annie path lever 6 brings insane utility and damage. You will out scale other support toward mid game and carry

Morgana - Morgana is very strong at protecting carries . Her ultimate has higher utility than regular supports .

Janna - her late game utility is unmatched .  I always pick her with Caitlyn or jinx for insane damage .

Blitz - I pick blitz to shut down cheesy supports like zilean,brand,velkoz and other squashy scam.

Yeah being a support in silver kinda sucks, while in silver and bronze you have to play champions that makes big plays, people's morale is way flimsier so when you outplay them they start playing worse and worse and ultimately you'll win.

When you get to gold things change a bit, people is way more secure about what they're doing and mechanically you can trust your adc to be a bit more competent. As a matter of fact, in gold and above, bot lane's pace is determined by the support and not the adc.

So I'd suggest to start playing something else until you reach gold where people know how to take advantage of your power.

Y'know, honestly, I don't really agree with this. I main support, have had for close to two seasons now. On a whim I decided to play Ranked for the first time this past season, played nothing but Nami and Sona (And one super awkward jungle Shyv game) and my placements were a mess. But, I wound p getting placed into Silver 5. From there I wound up being able to climb up to Silver 3 before I got distracted by life and had to walk away from League for a while. Supporting in Ranked isn't as much as a slog as people keep claiming it is. I honestly think Jungle has the roughest time with it.

I Jungled my way from Bronze 1 to Gold 2 so far this season. Playing mostly Solo or Duo in 98% of the cases. 

I want to main Support, but I know it would be super hard pre-plat.

In all seriousness though the best piece of advice I got when climbing silver as a support main is to play scaling ap mages( brand, lux, velkoz) or champions that have low cd impactful ults( karma, sona, braum). The more you play the better your micro and understanding of the game will be. Communication is also huge. If you get ahead get deep wards( enemy jungle) and roam. The more people you can help the better off your team will be. Lastly don't tilt and if you do keep it to yourself. Support is generally the least micro intensive role besides jungle in the game. Solo laners and AD's have to dedicate a lot of their focus on farming and trading and don't need your venting stacked on that. If you can do anything to mitigate awareness issues on their part do it. Call out summoners and and enemy jungler location. Ping ALL lanes that don't have enemy champions in them for prolonged periods of time. Big objectives should be warded constantly after the 10 minute mark. It's a slow climb but a rewarding one   (:   .
